com.io7m.jvvfs

Class Filesystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.io7m.jvvfs.Filesystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FilesystemType, FSCapabilityAllType, FSCapabilityCloseType, FSCapabilityCreateDirectoryType, FSCapabilityMountAnywhereType, FSCapabilityMountClasspathType, FSCapabilityMountDirectoryType, FSCapabilityMountSnapshotType, FSCapabilityReadType, FSCapabilityUnmountType, FSCapabilityUpdateTimeType

    public final class Filesystem
extends Object
implements FilesystemType

    The basic filesystem implementation.

    This implementation supports loading of archives from a single directory, or from the classpath.

    See Also:
    makeWithArchiveDirectory(LogUsableType, PathReal), makeWithoutArchiveDirectory(LogUsableType)

      • makeWithArchiveDirectory

        public static FilesystemType makeWithArchiveDirectory(com.io7m.jlog.LogUsableType log,
                                                      PathReal archives)

        Construct a filesystem using archives as the location of the archive directory.

        Parameters:
        log - The log interface
        archives - The archive directory
        Returns:
        A new filesystem

      • makeWithoutArchiveDirectory

        public static FilesystemType makeWithoutArchiveDirectory(com.io7m.jlog.LogUsableType log)

        Construct a filesystem without an archive directory. A filesystem constructed in this manner may only access archives on the classpath.

        Parameters:
        log - The log interface
        Returns:
        A new filesystem

      • close

        public void close()
           throws FilesystemError
        Description copied from interface: FSCapabilityCloseType

        Close the given filesystem. This:

        • Unmounts and closes all archives
        • Removes all virtual directories

        Due to archives being closed, the state of any streams associated with files in the filesystem will become undefined.

        Specified by:
        close in interface FSCapabilityCloseType
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If a filesystem error occurs.

      • mountArchive

        public void mountArchive(String archive,
                         PathVirtual mount)
                  throws FilesystemError
        Description copied from interface: FSCapabilityMountDirectoryType

        Mount the archive archive at mount. The path specified by mount is required to refer to an existing directory.

        If the directory at mount exists but was not explicitly created with FSCapabilityCreateDirectoryType.createDirectory(PathVirtual), then the mountArchive function first calls FSCapabilityCreateDirectoryType.createDirectory(PathVirtual) to mark mount as explicitly created, and then attempts to mount the archive as normal.

        Specified by:
        mountArchive in interface FSCapabilityMountDirectoryType
        Parameters:
        archive - The archive to mount.
        mount - The mount point for the archive.
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If a filesystem error occurs.

      • mountArchiveFromAnywhere

        public void mountArchiveFromAnywhere(File archive,
                                     PathVirtual mount)
                              throws FilesystemError
        Description copied from interface: FSCapabilityMountAnywhereType

        Mount the archive archive at mount. The path specified by mount is required to refer to an existing directory.

        If the directory at mount exists but was not explicitly created with FSCapabilityCreateDirectoryType.createDirectory(PathVirtual), then the mountArchive function first calls FSCapabilityCreateDirectoryType.createDirectory(PathVirtual) to mark mount as explicitly created, and then attempts to mount the archive as normal.

        Specified by:
        mountArchiveFromAnywhere in interface FSCapabilityMountAnywhereType
        Parameters:
        archive - The archive to mount.
        mount - The mount point for the archive.
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If a filesystem error occurs.

      • mountClasspathArchive

        public void mountClasspathArchive(Class<?> c,
                                  PathVirtual mount)
                           throws FilesystemError
        Description copied from interface: FSCapabilityMountClasspathType

        Mount the archive containing class c at mount. The path specified by mount is required to refer to an existing directory.

        If the directory at mount exists but was not explicitly created with FSCapabilityCreateDirectoryType.createDirectory(PathVirtual), then the mountArchive function first calls FSCapabilityCreateDirectoryType.createDirectory(PathVirtual) to mark mount as explicitly created, and then attempts to mount the archive as normal.

        Specified by:
        mountClasspathArchive in interface FSCapabilityMountClasspathType
        Parameters:
        c - A class appearing in one of the archives on the classpath.
        mount - The mount point for the archive.
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If a filesystem error occurs.

      • unmount

        public void unmount(PathVirtual mount)
             throws FilesystemError
        Description copied from interface: FSCapabilityUnmountType

        Unmounts the most recently mounted archive at mount. If another archive is mounted at a directory contained within the archive that would be unmounted, the operation fails.

        Specified by:
        unmount in interface FSCapabilityUnmountType
        Parameters:
        mount - The mount point.
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If a filesystem error occurs.

      • updateModificationTime

        Description copied from interface: FSCapabilityUpdateTimeType

        Updates the modification time of the object at path to t.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        path - The mount point.
        t - The requested time.
        Throws:
        FilesystemError - If a filesystem error occurs
